flashy.butils.writeSubmit(subfile, code, pbsins=[], time='12:00:00', nodes=1252, ompth=16, proj='', mail='')[source]

builds a submit.pbs with a typical header, specifying walltime and nodes, then adding slines of code below. Exports OMP_NUM_THREADS=ompth titan: aprun (-j1) -n 1 -d 16 debug: -D (int) rhea: mpirun –map-by ppr:N:node:pe=Th or -n debug: –display-map / –report-bindings Rhea max: 48 hours on 16 nodes (2x8 core p/node: -np 256) Titan: <125 nodes 2h, <312 nodes 6h…

flashy.cgs module

CGS and Nuclide module. This module can handle abundances, mass fractions and Isotope weighing.

flashy.cgs.convXmass2Abun(species, xmasses)[source]

Returns abundances, abar and zbar from a list of nuclide codes and mass fractions.

flashy.cgs.convertYield2Abundance(mdict, norm='H', offset=12.0)[source]

Turns mass yields into abundances.

flashy.cgs.elemSplit(s)[source]

Standalone element name spliter. (A, name) he4 -> (4, He)

flashy.cgs.fetchNuclides(flist, lowercase=True)[source]

filters flash otp field list, extracting species found in the checkpoint.

flashy.cgs.getAbundances(names, massfrac, scale='H', offset=12)[source]

Returns abundances for a list of species and mass Fractions, scaled by a set species.

flashy.cgs.getMassFractions(names, abun)[source]

Takes log abundances and species names to weigh them and return mass fractions. returns mass fractions.

flashy.cgs.getTotalMass(massdict)[source]

Sums all isotope masses in a massdict

flashy.cgs.getXYZ(masses)[source]

Returns Hydrogen, Helium and Metal Fractions from given mass fractions (assumes H and He at start of list).

flashy.cgs.plotAbun(ax, mdict, norm='H', offset=12.0, label='W7', color='black')[source]

draws abundances vs atomic number, returns label and line element for legend

flashy.cgs.plotIsoMasses(ax, mdict, label='W7', color='black', ylims=[1e-18, 1.0], notag=False)[source]

draws isotopic masses vs atomic mass, returns label and line element for legend

flashy.cgs.plotPfac(ax, querym, refname='/lustre/atlas/proj-shared/csc198/frivas/02.flashy/flashy/data/suncomp/AGSS09.comp', label='Sun vs Ref', norm='Si', offset=6, reftype='solar')[source]

draws abundquery/abundref from a massdict and a filename, types of reference are ‘solar’(for solar composition) and ‘yield’ (for other sims) returns label and line element for legend

flashy.cgs.readNuclideMasses()[source]

Reads an AMDC format table (Wang 2017 41 030003). AMDC atomic masses (2017): http://amdc.in2p3.fr/web/masseval.html Reads only masses, there’s more data within it so this function is extensible. output is a dict with capitalized element names, then a z and n key to access z and a keyset of N numbers.

flashy.cgs.readStandardWeights()[source]

Returns a species dict with standard atomic weights from: http://www.ciaaw.org/atomic-weights.htm: http://www.ciaaw.org/pubs/TSAW2013_xls.xls # CIAAW only tabulates 2013 values so no Tennessine :( and only in xls. # Abridged values. Ranges are picked on their lower end.

flashy.cgs.readSunComp(filename)[source]

Read a 6 column file with solar composition (Z name abundance abunerror meteoriticAb mAberror) mixes meteor and spectral/inferred abundances for completion.

flashy.cgs.readYield(filename)[source]

Reads a mass yield file or a zipped list (for simulation yields) Returns a mass dictionary.

flashy.cgs.speciesGrid(ax, spcodes, yoffset=5.0)[source]

draws a grid of the specified species on target ax.

flashy.cgs.splitSpecies(Spcodes, trueA=True)[source]

returns list of symbols, Z, N, A from a list of nuclide codes.(Ni56, He4, U238, …)

flashy.paramSetup.readSetupParams(filename)[source]
flashy.paramSetup.setupFLASH(module, runfolder, kwargs={'threadBlockList': 'true'}, nxb=4, nyb=8, nzb=0, geometry='cylindrical', maxbl=500, debug=False, portable=True)[source]

calls ./setup at _FLASH_DIR with given parameters, writing the code to destination for compiling afterwards. (must be run on a Py2.X kernel)

Parameters

  • module (str) – name of Simulation folder to setup.

  • runfolder (str) – run folder (creates _cdx, and _otp within it).

  • kwargs (dict) – keyword arguments to setup

  • n[xyz]b (int) – cells per block for setup.

  • geometry (str) – cartesian, spherical, cylindrical(default).

  • maxbl (int) – maximum blocks per proc. elem.

  • debug (bool) – show terminal output.
